      • connect

        public com.intellij.util.messages.impl.MessageBusConnectionImpl connect(Disposable parentDisposable)
        Description copied from interface: MessageBus
        Allows to create new connection that is bound to the given Disposable. That means that returned connection will be automatically released if given disposable parent is collected.
        Specified by:
        connect in interface MessageBus
        Parameters:
        parentDisposable - target parent disposable to which life cycle newly created connection shall be bound
        Returns:

      • syncPublisher

        public <L> L syncPublisher(Topic<L> topic)
        Description copied from interface: MessageBus
        Allows to retrieve an interface for publishing messages to the target topic.

        Basically, the whole processing looks as follows:

        1. Messaging clients create new connections within the target message bus and subscribe to the target topics;
        2. Every time somebody wants to send a message for particular topic, he or she calls current method and receives object that conforms to the business interface of the target topic. Every method call on that object is dispatched by the messaging infrastructure to the subscribers. broadcasting is performed if necessary as well;

        It's also very important to understand message processing strategy in case of nested dispatches. Consider the following situation:

        1. Subscriber1 and subscriber2 are registered for the same topic within the same message bus;
        2. Message1 is sent to that topic within the same message bus;
        3. Queued messages delivery starts;
        4. Queued messages delivery ends as there are no messages queued but not dispatched;
        5. Message1 is queued for delivery to both subscribers;
        6. Queued messages delivery starts;
        7. Message1 is being delivered to the subscriber1;
        8. Subscriber1 sends message2 to the same topic within the same bus;
        9. Queued messages delivery starts;
        10. Important: subscriber2 is being notified about all queued but not delivered messages, i.e. its callback is invoked for the message1;
        11. Queued messages delivery ends because all subscribers have been notified on the message1;
        12. Message2 is queued for delivery to both subscribers;
        13. Queued messages delivery starts;
        14. Subscriber1 is notified on message2
        15. Subscriber2 is notified on message2

        Thread-safety. All subscribers are notified sequentially from the calling thread.

        Memory management. Returned objects are very light-weight and stateless, so, they are cached by the message bus in 'per-topic' manner. That means that caller of this method is not obliged to keep returned reference along with the reference to the message for further publishing. It's enough to keep reference to the message bus only and publish like 'messageBus.syncPublisher(targetTopic).targetMethod()'.

        Specified by:
        syncPublisher in interface MessageBus
        Type Parameters:
        L - business interface of the target topic
        Parameters:
        topic - target topic
        Returns:
        publisher for target topic

        public final void dispose()
        Description copied from interface: MessageBus
        Disposes current bus, i.e. drops all queued but not delivered messages (if any) and disallows further connections.
        Specified by:

      • hasUndeliveredEvents

        public boolean hasUndeliveredEvents(Topic<?> topic)
        Specified by:
        hasUndeliveredEvents in interface MessageBus
        Returns:
        true when events in the given topic are being dispatched in the current thread, and not all listeners have received the events yet.
